Sergiu Oprea

PhD student in Computer Science at University of Alicante

Email: soprea@dtic.ua.es

About Me

Hi there!

I am currently a Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of Alicante. I am broadly interested in building the next generation of deep learning-based video prediction systems. My research interests span topics mainly in:

  • Deep Learning
  • Computer Vision
  • Virtual/Augmented Reality

I am also passionated about CUDA programming, 3D computer graphics and AI.

By the way, I am really proud of my latest work done in Unreal Engine 4 about realistic hand interaction in VR. Take a look to UnrealGrasp.

Projects

UnrealGrasp

UnrealGrasp is a flexible and visually realistic grasping system designed to enable natural and real-time interactions in virtual reality applications.

Description about the work on/with the project

  1. Garcia-Garcia, A., Martinez-Gonzalez, P., Oprea, S., Castro-Vargas, J. A., Orts-Escolano, S., Garcia-Rodriguez, J., & Jover-Alvarez, A. (2018). The RobotriX: An Extremely Photorealistic and Very-Large-Scale Indoor Dataset of Sequences with Robot Trajectories and Interactions. In 2018 IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems (IROS) (pp. 6790–6797). https://doi.org/10.1109/IROS.2018.8594495
